Adds an edge to an undirected graph. 

Since undirected graphs are internally represented as symmetric graphs, this function adds two arcs (src, dest) and (dest, src) to the graph. \mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1Graph_a889112da0e6fbb580a3d1066d6abdd01}\label{namespacegft_1_1Graph_a889112da0e6fbb580a3d1066d6abdd01}}

\index{Transpose@{Transpose}!gft::Graph@{gft::Graph}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Transpose()}{Transpose()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1Graph_1_1sGraph}{s\+Graph}} $\ast$ gft\+::\+Graph\+::\+Transpose (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1Graph_1_1sGraph}{s\+Graph}} $\ast$}]{graph }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Computes the transpose of a directed graph. 

Transpose of a directed graph G is another directed graph on the same set of vertices with all of the arcs reversed compared to the orientation of the corresponding arcs in G. That is, if G contains an arc (u, v) then the transpose of G contains an arc (v, u) and vice versa. \mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1Graph_a06031bf28bd661c252dc71a38aea3dd5}\label{namespacegft_1_1Graph_a06031bf28bd661c252dc71a38aea3dd5}}
